result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony A Roach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 4 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.  $200 DNA surcharge assessed.
With Huber for child care. DO NOT REPORT LATE OR UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL OR CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY REQUIRED.

from Zimmerman Consulting Inc. - defendant is in compliance with agency requirements.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: ***DEFT HAS UNTIL 6/11/15 TO POST BOND***  ***ALSO $750.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with the victim TA (person, property, residence or family).   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Anthony A Roach in court with attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Matter is scheduled for bond review on the Court's Motion.
Deft has a seasonal job now and an interview tomorrow at Cree.
Deft has an assessment scheduled.
State is requesting that bond be modified to $50 cash with a $750 signature bond and would not object to bond being posted w/in 48 hrs.
Def would agree with the State's recommendation.
BTC: Set bond at $50 cash with a $750 signature bond, deft has until 6-11-15 to post bond, all other conditions remain.
Bail/bond hearing on June 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
